topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Alpha): Creating a Instance Using a Volume

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Alpha): Creating an Instance from a Volume

body.p: Compute instances are virtual machines that run inside the cloud. You can create an instance directly from the Volumes screen.

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Helion Dashboard.
Click the Compute tab on the dashboard Project panel.
In the Compute panel, click Volumes.
In the Volumes screen, for the volume you want for the instance, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Launch as Instance.
The Launch Instance dialog box opens, with five tabs: Details, Access and Security, Networking, Post Creation, and Advanced Options. By default, Details is the active tab.
Note that the Instance Boot Source and Volume fields are specified, based on the selected volume.
Use the Flavor Details list to make sure the disk size is sufficient.
For details on the dialog box, see Create a New Compute Instance.
